front.title: Media Policy Manipulation in the Conference Policy Control Protocol

abstract.t: The SIP conferencing framework defines a model for tightly-coupled conferencing in the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP), in which a Conference Policy Control Protocol is used to manipulate policies relevant to a specific conference, such as conference membership policy, authorization policy, and media policy. This document describes a logical model to describe media processing in a SIP conference. It also defines specific protocol semantics and a specific syntax to manipulate that model.
